result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen K Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall pay $100 fine + costs to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days or set payment plan.
Shall pay $612.93 to Watertown Farm & Fleet; paid through the Clerk of Courts.
Defendant shall not go on the premises at Farm & Fleet, Watertown WI.
Shall write a letter of apology to Watertown Farm & Fleet and submit to agent.

supervisions.notes: with work release and transfer privileges

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen K Mueller

Findings and Order
Corp. Counsel

Defendant Karen K Mueller not in court. Prosecuting Atty Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen appeared for State of Wisconsin.File reviewed; def found in contempt; Court orders costs on motion and 30 days DCJ w/h&t if not paid in full by 5/1/17; Court orders income withholding

for finding of contempt of court for failure to pay appointed counsel fees, for imposition of remedial sanctions, for costs on motion and for judgment; affidavit in support of motions; and order for hearing

Defendant Karen K Mueller in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thompson heard regarding inconsistencies in revocation paper work, he spoke w/ Ms. Zibinski and her recommendation is for 9 months. Atty Jansen heard. Ct. heard, finds victim rights compliances. Atty Jansen heard on revocation summary. Atty Thompson heard on argument. Atty Jansen heard on argument. Def. makes statement. Ct. heard, imposes sent.:


9 months DCJ w/ H&T.
Judgment for any unpaid obligation;

134 days credit

Restitution Summary

9:27 - Defendant, Karen K Mueller in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Defendant enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Wttn Farm & Fleet 1400 W Main St, Watertown.  Return date scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
